titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Barbara Ann Conlogue Collection of Eleanor Steber Photographs and Clippings, circa 1935-1990
Conlogue (Barbara Ann) Collection of Eleanor Steber Photographs and Clippings
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley, February 2010.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library
publicationstmt.p: © 2010. State University of New York at Buffalo. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley, February 2010.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard ).

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Barbara Ann Conlogue Collection of Eleanor Steber Photographs and Clippings, circa 1935-1990

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The Barbara Ann Conlogue Collection of Eleanor Steber Photographs and Clippings, circa 1935-1990 contains 383 images and eight clippings documenting the life and career of soprano Eleanor Steber. The collection includes stock publicity photographs, but is special for the many informal snapshots of Steber at various functions throughout her career. The snapshots include photographs of a television screen during broadcasts of Steber performances.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Barbara Ann Conlogue Collection of Eleanor Steber Photographs and Clippings, circa 1935-1990, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Barbara Ann Conlogue's cousin, Joanne Oakes, in 2007-2009.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: All images have been digitized and are available in University Libraries Digital Collections.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Molly O'Brien, 2008-2009. Corrections and additional identifications supplied by Margaret Ulmer, April 2016

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Eleanor Steber was born 17 July 1916 in Wheeling, West Virginia. She made her premiere with the Metropolitan Opera in 1940 and remained with the company until 1963. She is noted for her work as the first Vanessa in Samuel Barber’s opera of that name and she also commissioned the composer for his work, Knoxville: Summer of 1915. She performed the title role of Arabella in Richard Strauss’s opera in the American premiere at the Metropolitan Opera in 1955 and sang the part of Marie in Alban Berg’s Wozzeck in the first performance by the Metropolitan Opera in 1959. Steber devoted her later years to teaching, working at the Cleveland Institute, Juilliard, and her alma mater, New England Conservatory. She established the Eleanor Steber Music Foundation to assist young singers in the early stages of their careers. Steber died in Langhorne, Pennsylvania 3 October 1990.

Barbara Ann Conlogue was a devoted fan of Eleanor Steber. She was born 23 April 1928 in New York, daughter of Donald and Mary T. (Durant) Conlogue. She grew up in Maine and Massachusetts. She attended nursing school and was employed as a nurse by Dr. Harold A. Titus of Chelmsford, Massachusetts. It is possible that it was Dr. Titus who introduced Barbara Ann Conlogue to Eleanor Steber. Barbara Ann died 27 December 1995 in Lowell, Massachusetts. [Biographical information courtesy of Joanne Oakes.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Barbara Ann Conlogue Collection of Eleanor Steber Photographs and Clippings, circa 1935-1990 contains 383 images of soprano Eleanor Steber. The collection includes stock publicity photographs, but is special for the many informal snapshots of Steber at various functions throughout her career. The snapshots include photographs of a television screen during broadcasts of Steber performances. There are eight clippings in the collection, including three obituaries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series:

scopecontent.p: Review of recital at Liberty Hall, Lowell, Massachusetts, with photographs of Steber, her accompanist Edwin Biltcliffe, and Lowell residents, Barbara Conlogue, Hugh Downey, and Cathy Mirras.

defitem.label: J. Warren Perry Collection of Photographs Mus. Arc. 3.1
defitem.item: This collection of 2110 photographs contains 26 photographs of Eleanor Steber. The collection is also available in UBdigit.
